In the Stepnohirsk direction, Russian forces intensified their assault operations and have made significant progress.
In Stepnohirsk, Russian forces managed to consolidate in the northern high-rise buildings of the 3rd Micro-district, before advancing further north, where they entrenched along Ahrarna Street which was already a grey zone. Due to recent emergency Ukrainian redeployments to the Hulyaipole direction, the Ukrainians were unable to carry out their usual clearing operations on Ahrarna Street, allowing for Russian soldiers to accumulate and cross the river at multiple points.
From there, the Russians secured Tavriivska Street and outflanked the block of high-rise buildings in central Stepnohirsk from the east and west, capturing additional positions in the residential areas. Infiltrations are now taking place towards the rear of the high-rises, as well as into its southern buildings, where grey-zones have formed.
Meanwhile, in the southeast, Russian forces resumed their assault operations, recapturing previously lost positions in eight different treelines northeast of Kamyanske.
In the northwest, the Russians consolidated additional positions in the southern part of Prymorske, while DRGs continue infiltrating to the second gulley.
+ ~6.37 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

Over the last 12 days, local Palestinian armed groups affiliated with the Palestinian Islamic Jihad's Saraya Al-Quds Brigades claimed responsibility for 19 attacks across the West Bank.
The "Jenin Battalion" stated that their fighters carried out 10 IED attacks, 2 small arms attacks, and 1 hand-grenade attack on IDF soldiers and vehicles in the towns of Silat al-Harithiya and Qabatiya, as well as the village of Marek. The IDF didn't report any casualties among their forces.
The "Nablus Battalion" stated that their fighters carried out 1 IED attack, 1 hand-grenade attack, and 1 small arms attack on IDF military vehicles in the Balata Refugee Camp in Nablus City. The IDF didn't report any casualties among their forces. 
The "Tubas Battalion" stated that their fighters carried out 2 IED attacks and 1 small arms attack in the city of Tubas. The IDF didn't report any casualties among their forces.
The PIJ reported that multiple Israeli soldiers were wounded as a result of these recent attacks, however this has not been confirmed. The PIJ also announced the deaths of 6 of its fighters, while the Al-Aqsa Martyrs Brigades announced the death of 1 of its fighters. 
As usual with these attacks, limited coordination between militant cells and a lack of training means that the results are very limited.

This evening, 1 Iskander-M ballistic missile launched from the vicinity of Liski, Voronezh Oblast impacted an unknown target in the Slobidskyi District of Kharkiv City.

Last night's Russian Iskander-M ballistic missile strike on Kharkiv City likely targeted the "Kharkivska" 330 kV Electrical Substation. 
Coordinates: 49.96166, 36.28000

Last night, approximately 15 Russian Geran-2 drones attacked the "Crimean" 110 kV Electrical Substation in the northern suburbs of Odesa. A large fire broke out, resulting in power outages. 
Coordinates: 46.586317 30.780000

Overnight, Russia carried out another Geran-2 drone attack on eastern Dnipropetrovsk Oblast.
At least 4 drones impacted the village of Novomykolaivka, 3+ drones impacted the village of Dmytrivka, 2+ drones impacted the town of Vasylkivka, 2+ drones impacted Petrivka, 1+ drone impacted the village of Artemivka, and 1+ drone impacted the vicinity of Dobropillya.
All attached videos are from Vasylkivka.

Overnight, Russia carried out another Geran-2 drone attack on eastern Dnipropetrovsk Oblast.
At least 4 drones impacted the village of Novomykolaivka, 3+ drones impacted the village of Dmytrivka, 2+ drones impacted the town of Vasylkivka, 2+ drones impacted Petrivka, 1+ drone impacted the village of Artemivka, and 1+ drone impacted the vicinity of Dobropillya.
All attached videos are from Vasylkivka.

Overnight, Ukrainian UAVs attacked the production facilities of the "Nevinnomyssky Azot" chemical plant in the city of Nevinnomyssk, Stavropol Krai.
Nevinnomyssky Azot specialises in the production of mineral fertilizers and products of organic synthesis. It recently underwent expansion in 2024 to produce potassium nitrate.
Coordinates: 44.65613, 41.94300

Nevinnomyssky Azot specialises in the production of mineral fertilizers and products of organic synthesis. It recently underwent expansion in 2024 to produce potassium nitrate.

Overnight, Ukrainian UAVs once again attacked the Oryol Combined Heat and Power Plant. A fire was seen burning at the plant's storage tanks. 
Coordinates: 52.991210, 36.09396

Military Situation In Ukraine On December 3, 2025 (Maps Update)
Military Situation In Ukraine On December 3, 2025 (Maps Update)

Kiev Forces Are Losing Two Key Towns Near Pokrovsk And Siversk (Videos)
On December 3, the Russian military advanced around the city of Pokrovsk, which is already under its control, and near the city of Sivers, where it is already engaged in a fierce battle with Kiev forces, in Donetsk.
The Tsentr [Center] Group of Forces expanded its control in the southern part of Grishino, also known as Hryshyne, approaching the center of the settlement, which is located to the northwest of Pokrovsk.
To the east in Donetsk, Ukraine is about to receive another defeat in Siversk, where the Yug [South] Group of Forces is advancing.

Syria Seized Weapons Bound For Hezbollah, Still Got Hit By Israeli Strikes (Video, Photos)
Multiple Israeli drone strikes hit the governorate of Rif Dimashq in southern Syria on December 3, just a day after the country‚Äôs security forces announced the seizure of a weapon shipment allegedly bound to Hezbollah in neighboring Lebanon.
The Syrian Arab News Agency said that the strikes targeted Bat al-Ward hill and the road leading to it close to the town of Beit Jinn, which is located right on the front with the Israeli-occupied Golan Heights.
On December 2, The Syrian Ministry of Interior said that its forces seized a large shipment of landmines that was bound to Hezbollah in neighboring Lebanon.

Iran Has Begun To Receive New Air Defenses (Video)
The Iranian military has received a batch of newly-built Sevom Khordad medium-range air defense systems, in what may be the first such delivery since the end of the 12-day war with Israel last June.
The Israeli Republic didn‚Äôt announce the delivery, but it became known when a video showing three Sevom Khordad transporter erector launcher and radar (TELAR) vehicles moving on a highway to the west of the capital, Tehran, surfaced online on November 30. All the vehicles were painted in a green pattern not seen before.
While the Sevom Khordad was developed in Iran, its design resembles that of the Soviet-era Buk family of medium-range air defense systems.
The system‚Äôs TELAR is reported to be equipped with an X-band active phased array engagement radar that can simultaneously detect 100 aerial targets, engage four and guide two missiles towards a target.
